name: How to Create a Hex Flower

pages.name: How to Create a Hex Flower

text.content:
How to Create a Hex Flower

This system allows you to create and navigate custom "Hex Flowers" (Hexagonal Crawling Engines) within Foundry VTT.
You define your Hex Flower as a JSON Object containing a list of Cells.

1. The Structure

The basic JSON structure is:

{
  "cells": [
    { ... cell 1 ... },
    { ... cell 2 ... }
  ]
}

Everything else is optional, but you can add metadata at the root if you like (e.g., "version": "1.0").

2. Cell Properties

Each cell in the cells array represents one hexagon.

Mandatory Field

FieldTypeDescription
coordObjectThe cube coordinates: { "q": 0, "r": 0, "s": 0 }.

Tip: q + r + s must always equal 0.

Recommended Fields (Visuals)

FieldTypeDescription
emojiStringThe icon displayed in the center (e.g., "üå≤", "üíÄ").
colorStringHex background color (Hex code #RRGGBB or name).
bioma / name / stageStringThe primary title of the hex. The system auto-detects fields like bioma, name, title, stage, or encounter_type.

Optional Fields (Details)

The system is generic, meaning it will display any other field you add in the tooltip and logs.

  • description or summary: Displayed in italics in the tooltip.
  • tags: Can be a string or an object. Useful for mechanics like Difficulty, Weather, etc.
  • Custom Props: encounter_table, dc, loot, etc.

3. Example: Standard Biome Flower

{
  "cells": [
    {
      "coord": { "q": 0, "r": 0, "s": 0 },
      "bioma": "Highlands",
      "emoji": "‚õ∞Ô∏è",
      "color": "#A0522D",
      "tags": { "altitude": "High", "movement": "Diff" }
    },
    {
      "coord": { "q": 0, "r": -1, "s": 1 },
      "bioma": "Grassland",
      "emoji": "üåø",
      "color": "#90EE90",
      "tags": { "resource": "Herb" }
    }
  ]
}

4. Example: Narrative / Foreshadowing Engine

You can use completely different keys. The macro will adapt.

{
  "cells": [
    {
      "coord": { "q": 0, "r": 0, "s": 0 },
      "stage": "Normalcy",
      "emoji": "üè†",
      "color": "#cccccc",
      "description": "Life continues as normal, but something feels off.",
      "encounter_type": "Social",
      "clue_level": 0
    },
    {
      "coord": { "q": 1, "r": -1, "s": 0 },
      "stage": "The First Sign",
      "emoji": "üë£",
      "color": "#ffdddd",
      "description": "Tracks found where none should be.",
      "encounter_type": "Investigation",
      "clue_level": 1
    }
  ]
}

5. Coordinate System Cheat Sheet

Hex Flowers use "Cube Coordinates". From the center (0, 0, 0):

  • North: (0, -1, 1)
  • North-East: (1, -1, 0)
  • South-East: (1, 0, -1)
  • South: (0, 1, -1)
  • South-West: (-1, 1, 0)
  • North-West: (-1, 0, 1)

6. Importing into Foundry

  1. Copy your JSON text.
  2. Run the Hex Flower Manager macro.
  3. Click "Create / Import New Flower".
  4. Paste your JSON into the text area.
  5. Watch the Real-Time Preview to verify your map looks correct.
  6. Give it a name and click Save.
